concepts.term: A capacitor introduces a bit more complexity
Its voltage depends on the integral of the current over time, plus an initial condition
This shows how initial conditions affect our view of linearity
and why considering relative changes can be so useful

evidence: A capacitor introduces a bit more complexity
Its voltage depends on the integral of the current over time, plus an initial condition
If we focus on the relative change-the change from that initial state-the system behaves linearly
This shows how initial conditions affect our view of linearity
and why considering relative changes can be so useful
